TopicTitle: Thats a very nice report you should read.

Articles.Content: I found a report named: "NASAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Jet Propulsion Lab is obsessed with a certain game, and I bet you can guess what it is"
to be honest I wouldnt even read it as it looks dodgy IMO....plus from what you've posted I probably wouldn't be able to read it anyway....I can only speak English....just saying....
Sounds more like a headline than a report. I'm surprised it doesn't say "...and they couldn't stop staring."

You could link it, I'm too lazy to find it on my own

And I know what it is. Without a doubt they got obsessed with Moonbase Alpha.
This is the article. Currently it leads to a 404 page on the live website.

6/18/13

Well, since they cooperated in large part of the game back then, it's not surprising.

But one line caught my attention.

Some parts even have built-in telemetry tools that can automatically fire your engines for the proper amount of time and put you on the perfect heading. It might sound like cheating, but hey, NASA's got that mod too

and I like it.

On 7/21/2018 at 10:17 AM, The Aziz said:

You could link it, I'm too lazy to find it on my own

And I know what it is. Without a doubt they got obsessed with Moonbase Alpha.

So it was JPL employees spreading the holy word of John Madden and making all these songs for the text-to-speech system?

So a group of actual Rocket Surgeons may or may not be interested in what a very large group of rocket simulator gamers are doing?

GOOD.

A little imagination from the gaming community mixed in with some real world rocket experts may just yield some positive and useful ideas.

Cheers!

This very article was the thing that inspired me to buy KSP 

 

 

Edited July 23, 2018 by Mjp1050

This guy joins on Friday. Posts one thing on Friday and disappears.

 

Suspicious.

 

Everyone check for your wallets!
